reviews.text: Disappointment.  The menu looked great online and on the window but when my wife and I sat down we were handed a stained paper menu with about 6 salads and 6 entrees.  My choice wasn't on the list and had to try the "leg" of lamb.  It turned out to be a dry, recooked lamb steak with little flavor.  My wife's gnocci was bland except for the excessive use of garlic.  If they spent half the time working on making the food better as they do designing the plate it might be edible.  DO NOT GO!
Excellent Italian food. The bruschetta was the best I have ever had, and the sauce over the sweet potato gnocchi was great. One of my top three restaurants in Cville

I found this restaurant to be a great place for dinner, drinks, or anything in between. The atmosphere was great, and although the restaurant was quite loud, it was clean and friendly. The servers were polite and helpful. The food here was delicious. There was a wide variety of food, and everyone at our table loved their dinner.

Service was chaotic at best, waitress came up and spoke to us then never came back...the host eventually came and took an order.  Upon receiving our meals they were identical...despite ordering different things...oddly enough we heard the table behind us saying the same thing.  To top it all off we both woke up at 3 am with food poisoning!

Been here twice to the Andover location, once on a Friday evening and another on a Sunday afternoon and both times had no wait and was taken in quickly. I've been with just my husband and with 3 kids, and both times, different servers, friendly, kind and efficient. No complaints at all on service. Food was delicious and as close to authentic Mexican as I can get in MA, and I grew up in SoCal! Has quickly become a favorite spot. Family friendly restaurant.
Delicious well priced food, and attentive wait staff. What more can you ask for in a restaurant?

We had an enjoyable dinner here, no problem getting a table on a Friday night during peak dinner rush. It's bigger than it looks because there are 2 levels of seating. Service was very friendly. 

For dinner I had a burrito covered in a type of tomato sauce. It wasn't very good, tasted like a can of plain tomato sauce with very little flavor and too much acid. My husband got the fajitas and those were tasty. The margaritas were not good, way too sweet and tasted like it was made with bottled sour mix. 

We would go back for a casual meal, but at the end of the day it's on par with Border Cafe, On the Border, Moe's, etc.
